page.title: 16TOURISM:THE SPRINGS HOTEL
page.content: {Tourism}is represented by the Springs Hotel at North Stoke.It was originally built as a private residence for Sir Albert Condie-Stephens in 1894.He was a diplomat.It is in mock tudor style with black beams and white plaster set in an estate of 6 acres containing a lake.The hotel offers swimming in an outdoor heated pool,croquet and tennis. Riding,golf and squash can be arranged outside in the loacal area.The hotel has 28 rooms and can accomodate 53 guests.Visitors come from all over the world but mainly from the United States.They enjoy the quaintness of the area.The hotel is privatly owned and enploys 37 staff:3 managers,3 reception,9 kitchen,7 restaurant,3 bar ,7 houskeeping,3 porters and 2 gardeners .There is supposed to be a ghost there.
